meanings.definition: A rope or tackle used to extend a sail along a boom.
meanings.sent1: The sailor adjusted the outhaul to stretch the sail.
meanings.sent2: The outhaul helped the sail reach further along the boom.
meanings.sent3: The outhaul seemed like a magic rope, making the sail grow longer.
meanings.sent4: With the outhaul, the sail danced gracefully along the boom.
meanings.sent5: The outhaul's role was crucial in making the sail reach its full potential.

meanings.definition: To haul out or extend a sail using an outhaul.
meanings.sent1: She carefully outhauled the sail to catch more wind.
meanings.sent2: They outhaul the sail whenever they want to go faster.
meanings.sent3: The sailors joked that outhauling the sail was like pulling a giant rubber band.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outhaul the sail mirrored his drive to succeed.
meanings.sent5: Outhauling the sail required strength and precision to be effective.

meanings.definition: The act of extending a sail using an outhaul.
meanings.sent1: The smooth outhaul of the sail made it glide effortlessly.
meanings.sent2: His favorite part of sailing was the outhaul of the sail.
meanings.sent3: The outhaul of the sail was like a gentle tug-of-war with the wind.
meanings.sent4: The outhaul of the sail symbolized the start of a new adventure.
meanings.sent5: The outhaul of the sail was a moment of anticipation before the journey began.
